response_raw:
{
  "title": "Implementing CLI Tools Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+",
  "summary": "This explainer provides a comprehensive guide on how to create Command Line Interface (CLI) tools using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.",

  "key_points": [
    "Understanding FastAPI: FastAPI is a high-performance, modern, web framework for building APIs that natively supports async programming, automatic JSON responses, and more.",
    "Preparing the Environment: Ensure you have Python 3.12+ installed along with FastAPI and Uvicorn (an ASGI server used to run FastAPI applications).",
    "Creating a FastAPI Application: Start by creating a new FastAPI application using the command `fastapi init my_cli`.",
    "Implementing CLI Interface: To create a CLI, we will use a package called 'Click', which is not part of the FastAPI ecosystem but can be easily integrated. Install it with `pip install click`.",
    "Integrating Click and FastAPI: Create a separate module for the CLI commands and import it into your main FastAPI application. In the CLI module, define and register commands using Click's decorators.",
    "Registering CLI Commands: Use FastAPI's router system to register these commands as endpoints that can be accessed via HTTP.",
    "Running the Application: Start the FastAPI application with `uvicorn main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000` and interact with your CLI via the command line by sending requests to the appropriate HTTP endpoints.",
    "Code Example: Here's a simple example of a Hello World CLI using FastAPI, Click, and Uvicorn."
  ],

  "code_examples": [
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```\n\
import fastapi\nfrom fastapi.responses import JSONResponse\nfrom fastapi.routers import APIRouter\nfrom fastapi.openapi.utils import get_openapi\nfrom pydantic import BaseModel\nfrom typing import List\nimport click\n\napp = fastapi.FastAPI()\nrouter = APIRouter()\n\nclass Item(BaseModel):\tname: str\tdescription: str\n\nitems: List[Item] = []\n\n@app.get('/items', response_model=List[Item])\ndef get_items():\treturn items\n\n@router.post('/add_item')\ndef add_item(item: Item):\titems.append(item)\n\n@router.cli_route()\ndef cli():\tclick.echo('Welcome to the FastAPI CLI')\n\napp.include_router(router)\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    uvicorn.run(app, host='0.0.0.0', port=8000)\n```"
    }
  ],

  "version_notes": [
    "Python version: 3.12+"
  ],

  "caveats": [
    "While FastAPI supports CLI tools, it's worth noting that it was primarily designed for web APIs. Some features may not be as polished or well-documented compared to other dedicated CLI frameworks.",
    "The integration of Click and FastAPI is an optional choice and isn't officially supported by the FastAPI team. However, many developers find it to be a practical solution for creating CLI tools."
  ]
